list_definition.definition: (of a prisoner) to answer a charge, saying whether one is guilty or not

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: ‘How does the prisoner plead?’ ‘He pleads guilty.’

list_definition.definition: to present a case in court

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: My lawyer will plead my case
My lawyer will plead for me.

list_definition.definition: (often with with) to make an urgent request

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He pleaded with me not to go
He pleaded to be allowed to go.

list_ex_of_english: I regarded it as a very charming example of special pleading.
I am not pleading for any lessening of that aid.
There was a certain amount of special pleading.
Considering 'the genuineness of the teachers' plight ', they pleaded that the union should go on strike on the planned date irrespective of the consequences.
The national union for the pharmaceutical industry pleaded for a "partnership" and "discussions" with the associations.
He pleaded guilty to the first charge and not guilty to the second.
He pleaded for a complete change in the fiscal system as a means of dealing with unemployment.
Because the accused pleaded guilty, in those cases there would have been no jury under the normal system.
